intro: Ruehssia robinsonii, commonly known as the Robinson's ruehssia, is a rare and distinctive plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental species. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves with a glossy texture and produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
